title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 January 2017 - XWiki
content:

13:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <vmassol> ok so results of a multibranch pipeline using a jenkinsfile in scm: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/Contrib%20-%20Markdown%20(Jenkinsfile)/  
13:35 <Enygma`> has quit  
13:36 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <vmassol> cool just tested and it rebuilds automatically on commit too  
13:51 <tmortagne> vmassol: a better link to brag is http://ci.xwiki.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/Contrib%20-%20Markdown%20(Jenkinsfile)/ ;)  
13:52 <tmortagne> by the way did you see http://ci.xwiki.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/Contrib%20-%20Markdown%20(Jenkinsfile)/pr ?  
13:52 <tmortagne> sounds interresting  
13:53 <vmassol> nice  
13:54 <vmassol> doesn't seem to work yet  
14:25 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <vmassol> does someone see anything wrong with my PR for dockerhub images? https://github.com/docker-library/official-images/pull/2563  
15:09 <vmassol> it's failing their travis ci  
15:09 <vmassol> but I don't see any difference when compared to some other PR that are passing at https://github.com/docker-library/official-images/pulls  
15:09 <vmassol> for ex the groovy one: https://github.com/docker-library/official-images/pull/2575/files  
15:23 <edvorg> has quit  
15:34 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <edvorg> has quit  
15:53 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <msmeria1> has quit  
16:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: even better I've set up an xwiki-contrib organization folder job on ci.xwiki.org  
16:16 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/  
16:17 <vmassol> so any repo that adds a jenkinsfile will be automatically built, and for all branches  
16:17 <vmassol> for ex right now it's building http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/syntax-markdown/ - 2 branches  
16:17 <vmassol> once it has finished I'll delete the VMA\_TEST branch and check it's deleted on the ci  
16:18 <tmortagne> vmassol: nice, no need to create job for contrib project anymore  
16:19 <vmassol> cool it worked!  
16:19 <vmassol> just deleted the branch  
16:19 <vmassol> and now it doesn't appear anymore on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/syntax-markdown/  
16:19 <vmassol> :)  
16:20 <vmassol> next step is to improve the jenkinsfile and add a library of shared groovy functions for jenkinsfile  
16:20 <simfir> has quit  
16:20 <vmassol> I'll move the mail notif for ex in there  
16:21 <simfir> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <vmassol> FYI this is what I have ATM: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/syntax-markdown/blob/master/Jenkinsfile  
16:22 <vmassol> most of it can be moved into shared functions  
16:30 <tmortagne> ok  
16:31 <tmortagne> I should probably do the same for confluence repository  
16:31 <vmassol> you could either copy it or wait till I have created the shared lib  
16:32 <tmortagne> I'm almost done with the move but I might not have the time to finish today  
16:35 <vmassol> hmm I wanted to put the jenkins libs in our https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-dev-tools  
16:35 <vmassol> but it doesn't seem possible since it needs a repo for itself  
16:37 <vmassol> so I'll propose to create a repo in https://github.com/xwiki  
16:38 <vmassol> we could also use xwiki-contrib but it would be a bit weird to use that for building xwiki org repos  
16:38 <tmortagne> I don't understand, there is nothing to build in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-dev-tools  
16:39 <tmortagne> ha libs, sorry  
16:39 <vmassol> it's about wheer to find the groovy libs  
16:39 <vmassol> see https://github.com/jenkinsci/workflow-cps-global-lib-plugin  
16:39 <tmortagne> I guess you need to "release" them or something  
16:43 <vmassol> jenkins need to access it yes, the version to use (sha1, tag, branch) is specified in jenkins  
16:59 <evalica1> has quit  
17:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: why did you reopen http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13977 ?  
17:04 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: because with the change in the html package you did in XWIKI-13976 I don't think its a duplicate anymore  
17:06 <vmassol> wdym?  
17:06 <vmassol> the guy seems to want links internal to the PDF  
17:07 <tmortagne> yes  
17:07 <tmortagne> when there is sevral pages  
17:07 <tmortagne> it was closed as duplicate of XWIKI-13976  
17:07 <vmassol> ahhhh  
17:07 <tmortagne> I don't think the way you fixed XWIKI-13976 fixes XWIKI-13977  
17:07 <vmassol> PDF not HTML  
17:08 <tmortagne> yes PDF  
17:08 <vmassol> need to check if PDF uses HTML exactly or not, don't remember fully  
17:09 <tmortagne> it use the same URL factory (at least it used to, not sure how it looks like these days)  
17:09 <evalica> has quit  
17:09 <vmassol> I'll check it  
17:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: PDF export uses PdfURLFactory while HTML export uses ExternalURLFactory  
17:25 <vmassol> (they're different)  
17:25 <tmortagne> ok they used to use a ExportURLFactory  
17:25 <nirmankarta> has joined #xwiki  
17:26 <tmortagne> "ExternalURLFactory" naming sounds weird since it does not produce only external URLs  
17:26 <vmassol> sorry  
17:26 <vmassol> typo  
17:26 <vmassol> ExportURLFactory  
17:26 <tmortagne> ok  
17:26 <tmortagne> so PDF export moved to its own URL factory then  
17:26 <vmassol> yes it's completely different  
17:26 <vmassol> and it doesn't hadle links AFAICS  
17:27 <vmassol> only attachments/images  
17:27 <vmassol> although its javadoc says it does  
17:27 <vmassol> well it's not clear  
17:28 <vmassol> anyway  
17:28 <vmassol> transforming external URLs into internal URLs is not done  
17:55 <tmortagne> has quit
